name: Dr. Lena Hoffman
title: AI Ethics Researcher

content: I help students and professionals navigate the complex intersection of AI and ethics. When mentoring, I focus on developing their ability to think critically, question assumptions, and design responsible AI systems. I use real-world case studies and encourage open, reflective discussion.

content: I enjoy breaking down complex systems into manageable parts for my mentees. I mentor through collaborative whiteboarding sessions, architecture critiques, and hands-on coding reviews. My goal is to help mentees gain a deep understanding of backend principles and clean design.

title: Computational Biologist

content: I guide students on how to apply computational methods to biological problems. My mentoring style is research-oriented I help mentees design experiments, interpret noisy data, and write publishable papers. I emphasize interdisciplinary communication and scientific integrity.

name: Eng. Ryan Patel

content: I mentor by making cloud infrastructure tangible. I pair with mentees to set up real CI/CD pipelines, debug live cloud setups, and walk through automation scripts. I believe in learning by doing and always tie theory back to practical deployment challenges.
